Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lebes-gamikos; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of body and thighs of two overlapping male figures to right; of further figure right thigh and perhaps top of greave visible; of nearer, bottom of bell corslet, skirt of short chiton (embroidered with maeander pattern; hem of zig-zags between triple lines within which a row of dots in faded colour) thighs and trace of top of possible greaves; panel bounded on left by vertical lotus and palmette chain (added red on palmette heart and alternate leaves; red on exterior and alternate interior lotus leaves) set off from scene by vertical brown line; inscription in field.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.442. Beazley suggested that the sherd may belong to a lebes-gamikos. Compare the sherd Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA234, which preserves part of the neck and can hardly be from a dinos. The pieces are illustrated and discussed, without knowledge of the Cambridge sherd, by Hirayama, H. 2010 Kleitias and Attic Black-figure Vases in the Sixth Century B.C., 43, B3 and pl. 32-c-d.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.13.1)
